intro: Pilosella subgudarica subsp. subgudarica, commonly known as the subgudarica groundsel, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish-green composite flowers. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
